pull.title: travis: Full clone for git subtree check

events.body: I disagree with this solution in the long run, but I'm going to cherry-pick this to the 0.16 branch to make travis pass there again.

travis: Full clone for git subtree check

events.message: travis: Full clone for git subtree check

events.body: I think it is a waste of time to micro-optimize travis solely for a questionable speedup. Note that the remote could be the bottleneck as well while counting and compressing the git objects. The runtime that travis reports for this commit/pull is `10.93s` whereas on current master it is `12.95s`.

issue.title: travis: Clone depth 1 unless $CHECK_DOC
issue.body:
As a tiny optimization, we can save about 5-9 seconds for each travis job by cloning only the tip, unless more commits are required for all the various meta checks.

Meant as fixup for my pull request #12405
